title: History & views of Athens
text: This is Athens we see on TV, postcards, movies... the Gods. Hercules... Aside from the obvious (history), you will enjoy the wonderful 360 views of Athens. Easy hike up to the top of the hill where most of the remains are, beauty & history combined. My favorite is the Erechtheion porch. Taking the steps down to Plaka you pass by Choragic Monument of Thrasyllos, “Our Lady in the Cave” church which is unfortunately not open to public & the Theater of Dionysus.

title: Top of the Hill
text: There it stands beautiful on the top of the hill. Breathtaking! Climbing up the stairs I was astonished by the wonderful views of the city and the history marked on every step. Free admission. Totally worth the stairs climbing. was astonished by the wonderful views of the city and the history marked on every step. Free admission. Totally worth the stairs climbing.

title: Spiritual Sema ceremony
text: I went there to see the Whirling Dervish. The music, the act itself, the voice of the singer, all soothing, serene & simply amazing. On the other hand the venue is beautiful, nicely renovated old building. They did a good job keeping the charm of the building on the top floor where the show is.

title: Great location
text: Good breakfast buffet, great location, good size room. Needs updating here & there. But overall good for value. Again location is amazing a short walk from Topkapı, Hagia Sophia, The blue mosque, museum of archeology, restaurants & my favorite Hafiz Mustafa Baklava & Sweets store.

title: The Bean
text: One of the 1st monuments that comes to mind when someone visiting asks where to go. A mirror surface sculpture sitting in Millennium Park reflecting Chicago’s gorgeous skyline & your image too.

title: The View!
text: Gorgeous view, elevator up then you need to take spiral stairs to the top. There is a restaurant which I didn’t try. I went there for the beautiful 360 view. I got the pass for the Tower top only no extras. Long line but moves fast.

title: Interesting
text: Overall interesting, missing the feel of that era as the renovations in some areas are a little bit clumsy resulted in jeopardizing some of the authenticity of the place. Love the mosaic & the domes. Got the 3 day pass for Hagia Sophia, Topkapı & the archeological museum which is a good deal. Remember separate pass for the Harem for 35 Turkish Lr which is ~ $5 USD. Not bad at all.

title: Astonishing architecture
text: You wouldn’t believe that it was built in 537 AD, breathtaking structure, gorgeous domes. You see the overlapped history and overlapped religions in this museum. I bought the ticket for 135 LT (which is a 3 day access to Hagia Sophia, Topkapı Saray & Istanbul Archaeological Museum ~ $25) Which is not bad at all. I believe it’s should be ranked #1 of the spots to visit in Istanbul. From the dome ceilings, mosaic ceilings & arches, fabulous walls, marble & mosaic floors, to the chandeliers, even the resting cats, everything is beautiful.

title: Magical
text: Magical experience, definitely a must if planning on going to Istanbul. You feel like a Sultan or a Sultana for the duration of the amazing experience, from the Hamam, the Bubble bath, sherbet & Turkish delight to the relaxing massage. I loved each & every minute. Not mentioning the great products they use, now a week later my skin is still super soft. Additionally you are receiving the service in a historic Hamam built for Hurrem Sultana, built by Mimar Sinan, amazing architecture, heated marble floors & walls and gorgeous dome ceilings with skylights.

title: Christmas lights
text: Colorful lights with Christmas music & hot chocolate. It was a perfect visit. Aside from holiday festivities, I love going to the zoo to have a nice walk. Cats (big cats) are my favorite. Also admission is free.

title: Beautiful!!!
text: Beautiful, beautiful building with gorgeous Tiffany domes, amazing walls and ceilings works. I felt as if I’m inside a piece of Jewelry. Also the admission is free!!!!! A must see!

title: Happiness
text: You have to go If you are in the area. Kanafa is amazing tried both the cheese kanafa & cream (qishta) kanafa.”, both are delicious.

title: Great flavors
text: Lebanese dishes, great flavors! Mix shawarma is delicious. Fattoush, tabouli and kebeh is a great option for an appetizer to share.

title: The highlight of my visit
text: Needless to say iconic! It’s incredibly astonishing historical structure. A must see during the day & at night too.

title: Interesting
text: Very interesting, I was more interested in the buildings, walls, doors & huge ravens than the royal family crowns and treasure last. Definitely a must see.

title: Beautiful Christmas Tree & Holiday Decorations
text: Has everything. I went there to see the Christmas tree & holiday decorations. Lovely market. Several restaurants. I ended up getting ice-cream from Venchi.

title: Luxury
text: Definitely luxurious, gorgeous entrance with the glass flowers ceiling. The high end retail stores, five star restaurants and the chocolate fountain. Room is nice & big, not really my taste in colors, mostly yellowish & maroon. Spacious bathroom. Overall great experience. I’m not a gambler, but love the colors & lights of the casino. I mainly go to Vegas for the shows, this time the trip was to see Elton John’s Million Dollar Piano show & Cirque Du Soleil “O”.

title: Nice beach
text: I was there in August, it wasn’t crowded, and really clean beach. Several restaurants close by. We enjoyed the sun for a couple of hours & headed back to the hotel which is within a walking distance.

title: Wonderful!
text: I’ve stayed there for a short weekend trip. Absolutely wonderful! Luxurious hotel with very elegant decor, restaurant with 360 gorgeous views & a panoramic elevator. Perfect location, very close to the beach & the promenade.

title: Colorful Breakfast
text: We stayed at the hotel for a short weekend trip. The restaurant has wonderful 360 views, very elegant decor. Breakfast came: Beautiful colorful presentation and yes very delicious. Don’t miss going up or down using the Panoramic elevator, gorgeous views.
place: The Penthouse at the Huntley Hotel

title: Lights lights lights
text: I go to Las Vegas for the shows mainly. I really love the energy, everybody is up after the middle of the night. Cars on the street, people going places, casino lights with lucky & unlucky gamblers, Hotels connected to one another...etc. It’s a unique city & definitely a unique experience.

title: A farewell to an outstanding performance
text: I went to Las Vegas specifically for Elton John’s show as it was one of his last ones. Outstanding performance, love his voice since I was a child. It was an amazing feeling seeing him performing live.
place: Elton John - The Million Dollar Piano

title: Souvenir stores & wonderful views of Canal Grande
text: Stores on the bridge. All kinds of souvenirs, authentic Venetian & not so authentic. I got a silver & murano glass pendant. Beside the crowded stores, the views are amazing from there.

title: Beautiful sunset
text: There you will see the Venice we see in photos, movies & read about in books. Beautiful old buildings on both sides, gondolas in the canal. The scene is even better around the sunset time. Whether you are having dinner at one of the restaurants, sitting in a gondola or even just walking. I had an amazing feeling just being there. Best views from the Rialto bridge or (even better) from the rooftop of the Fondaco Dei Tedeschi shopping center.

title: Breathtaking
text: A must see! first time there was around 10pm. The night didn’t hide the beauty of square. Basilica di San Marco is a breathtaking building with all the details, the sculptures, the paintings. The clock tower is another beautiful building with rich blue & gold details. I also went there early in the morning, a little bit foggy, charming though & the doves were everywhere!

title: Iconic
text: When you think of Paris Eiffel Tower comes to mind & vice versa. Needless to say I’m sure that it has to be incorporated in sightseeing plan. I didn’t go up, limited my visit to the grounds, long lines. Breathtaking structures, gardens need more maintenance though.

title: Half a day
text: Definitely a must, but do not spend a full day there unless you are specifically in Paris for museums. It’s huge you won’t be able to visit all sections & exhibits. I went there for half a day, I was interested in seeing specific exhibits/paintings/era & it was more than enough.

title: My favorite part of Paris
text: Vibrant & crowded with variety of food. Located right across the river from Notre Dame. A must visit location if you are in Paris or planning to go there! Try Amorino Gelato or the Crepes filled with Gelato, add macaroons to the wonderful experience & enjoy!

title: Great location, nice rooftop
text: Cozy with Venetian charm, delicious breakfast, very friendly staff and great location. I personally didn’t have trouble finding it. Make sure to follow signs. They are everywhere on the buildings walks, on the ground ... etc and you will get there. Has a very nice rooftop seating area which I’ve really enjoyed. Good price for what they offer, remember it’s Venice. Worth mentioning no elevator but I didn’t find that an issue.

title: Location Location Location
text: Great location across the street from the train station 10 min to Eiffel Tower. Small room but clean with updated bathroom. The front desk person when I checked in was very helpful vs the person when I checked out. WiFi Internet is slow in the room I stayed in. But overall good value for the price. Checkout the bakery across the street “Secco” delicious macaroons & croissant!

title: Loved it
text: Wonderful authentic hotel, beautiful hand painted tiles, delicious breakfast buffet, gorgeous views & great location. My room has a balcony with gorgeous view. Very nice outside breakfast area. Pool and lemon garden.

title: Must go!
text: Takes back in time or takes you to a movie scene :-) I saw the colosseum from the outside, it was a one day visit to Rome & didn’t have to stand in lines. The hotel where I stayed is 5 min walk so I went there in the morning & at night, two different experiences. It’s a must go!

title: Excellent!
text: Nice hotel, friendly & very helpful staff, great location and very good breakfast buffet. 5 minutes walk from the colosseum, Borgia steps across the street, train station is around the corner. Good size room for a European hotel. Overall great experience! I would definitely stay there again if I plan to go back to Rome.
